info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Charleroi, or 11 miles southeast of Gastonville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Monessen, California, Donora, Monongahela, Charleroi, Bentleyville, Perryopolis, New Eagle, North Belle Vernon, Wickerham Manor-Fisher, Baidland, and North Charleroi. This includes Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 33 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
